## Installation

You can install the development version of assign4 from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-xiaoranzhong0924")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(assign4)
```

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`? You can include R chunks like so:

```{r cars}
usethis::use_mit_license("Xiaoran Zhong")
```

You'll still need to render `README.Rmd` regularly, to keep `README.md` up-to-date. `devtools::build_readme()` is handy for this.

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo = FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

In that case, don't forget to commit and push the resulting figure files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.
```{r}
# Create the inst/shiny-app folder
usethis::use_directory("inst/shiny-app")

# Inside inst/shiny-app, create ui.R and server.R for your Shiny app.

#' Launch the Shiny App
#'
#' @export
launch_shiny_app <- function() {
  app_dir <- system.file("shiny-app", package = "assign4")
  shiny::runApp(app_dir, display.mode = "normal")
}
```
